Farm workers achieved increased wages, the right to unionize and health care benefits.
Cesar said “enough is enough” and led one of the most morally-righteous campaigns in the history of our country.
Farm workers toiled long hours for pennies a day. They worked in unsafe conditions, exposed to toxic pesticides. They lived in deep poverty.
United Farm Workers was founded by Cesar Chavez and Dolores Huerta in 1962 to address widespread exploitation of farm workers.
On #CesarChavezDay, let’s honor the work of Cesar Chavez and reflect on how to make progress in this country.
